title: My sister-in-law is so overbearing, I want to pull out of our family Christmas. What should I do?
text:
Dear A&E,

My sister-in-law (whom I tolerate, but we’re hardly soulmates) has already started emailing me about Christmas. She has decided it’s ‘easier’ if she hosts. For whom? She lives hours from the whole family, doesn’t have room for anyone to stay, is notoriously stingy (she’s ‘suggested’ I do lunch because she’ll be doing everything else) and starts fights with dismal regularity. Also, as far as I can tell, she and her husband loathe each other. My husband refuses to get involved. I want to kill the lot of them. — Murderous

Dear Murderous,

Ah, the Christmas spirit rears its head once more. Isn’t it reassuring to know that we are all in this together? That it never goes away, but rather mutates...
